newsitem.title: USA: Clinton Medicare plan falls short, CBO says.
newsitem.headline: Clinton Medicare plan falls short, CBO says.

text.p: President Clinton's balanced budget plan would expand Medicare benefits more than the White House has estimated, while falling short of promised spending reductions, the Congressional Budget Office said Tuesday.

CBO officials told the Senate Finance Committee that Clinton's plan will expand Medicare benefits by $4 billion more than that White House estimated over five years. At the same time, it will fall short of its goal of $100 billion in five-year spending reductions by $15 billion.
The CBO said the president's plan would reduce payments to managed care organizations by $30 billion over five years, which is about $4 billion less than the White House estimated.
